intro: Plectranthus andongensis, commonly known as the Andong mint, is a perennial herb native to South Korea. It is characterized by its aromatic, gray-green leaves and small, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of purple and blue. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sun. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties. Its compact growth habit makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and ground cover.
